intro: Bernhardia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers range in color from white to blue. Bernhardia spinosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
